articles.author: Rami Amichai
articles.description: More than 100 people were injured in violent clashes in Tel Aviv between Eritrean government supporters celebrating an Eritrea Day event and opponents of President Isaias Afwerki.
articles.title: More than 100 injured in Eritrean clashes in Tel Aviv

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Britain's opposition Labour Party has a 14-point lead over Prime Minister Rishi Sunak's ruling Conservatives, an opinion poll by market research company Opinium showed on Saturday as lawmakers prepare to return to parliament after the summer break.
articles.title: UK's Labour Party has 14-point lead over Conservatives - Opinium poll

articles.author: Felix Onuah
articles.description: President Bola Tinubu has ordered a recall of Nigeria's ambassadors the world over with immediate effect, his spokesman said on Saturday.
articles.title: Nigerian president recalls ambassadors worldwide

articles.author: Ahmed Kingimi
articles.description: At least seven worshippers were killed in an attack on a mosque by a gang of armed men in Nigeria's northwest Kaduna state, police said on Saturday.
articles.title: Gunmen kill seven worshippers in Nigeria's northern Kaduna state

articles.author: Tim Cocks, Carien Du Plessis
articles.description: Like many impoverished residents of downtown Johannesburg, Sihle Dube had rented a tiny room from someone who didn't actually own it, in a rundown building that was becoming a trash-strewn haven for drugs and crime.
articles.title: Life inside the 'hijacked' Johannesburg building where scores burned alive

articles.author: Philip Pullella
articles.description: Pope Francis, in words that appeared to be aimed at China rather than the neighbouring country he was visiting, said on Saturday that governments have nothing to fear from the Catholic Church because it has no political agenda.
articles.title: Pope, in Mongolia, sends apparent message to China on Catholic aims

articles.author: Andrew Macaskill
articles.description: Mohamed al-Fayed, the self-made Egyptian billionaire who bought the Harrods department store and promoted the discredited conspiracy theory that the British royal family was behind the death of his son and Princess Diana, has died, his family said.
articles.title: Mohamed al-Fayed, ex-Harrods owner whose son died with Princess Diana, dead at 94

articles.author: Jeff Mason
articles.description: U.S. President Joe Biden was in northern Florida on Saturday, surveying the damage caused by Hurricane Idalia and comforting people affected by the storm, though he had no plans to meet with Ron DeSantis, the state's Republican governor and a potential presidential rival.
articles.title: Biden surveys storm damage in Florida, will not meet with DeSantis

articles.author: Wa Lone, Anna Mehler Paperny
articles.description: A deal Canada struck this year to stem the flow of asylum seekers entering from the U.S. was, at first glance, a quick success: Within days, the number of people caught at unofficial crossings along the border dwindled to a trickle.
articles.title: Canada shut its land border to asylum seekers. More refugees came anyway

articles.author: Will Dunham
articles.description: Bill Richardson, a former U.S. diplomat, congressman, energy secretary and New Mexico governor who made his mark on the world stage by securing the release of Americans and others held by various autocratic governments, has died at the age of 75, the Richardson Center for Global Engagement said on Saturday.
articles.title: Bill Richardson, U.S. diplomat and troubleshooter, dead at 75
